intro: Aletris pauciflora var. khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi aletris, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and habitat specificity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
